content:
That's great to hear! It sounds like the hybrid bike has been a perfect fit for your daily commute, especially with the rough roads and potholes. The wider tires and more upright riding position can make a huge difference in terms of comfort and control, especially when dealing with rough terrain.

I can imagine that the hybrid bike's stability and forgiveness have also given you more confidence when navigating through traffic. It's always a great feeling to feel in control and comfortable on your bike, especially when you're commuting to work.

It's also interesting that you mention the hybrid bike being more stable and forgiving than your road bike. Road bikes are typically designed for speed and efficiency, but they can be less forgiving on rough roads or in heavy traffic. Hybrid bikes, on the other hand, are designed to be more versatile and practical, making them a great option for daily commuting.

Have you found that you're enjoying the commute more on the hybrid bike, or are there any other benefits you've noticed? For example, have you noticed any improvements in your overall fitness or mental well-being since switching to the hybrid bike?
